intro: Duguetia longicuspis, commonly known as the long-toothed bignonie, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family, characterized by its showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a distinctive shape with prominent veins. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
